title: Citibank Launches Three New ATMs at Three Locations Across Bahrain
summary: Manama, Bahrain - As part of its growth and expansion strategy, Citibank N.A. announced the installation of three automated teller machines (ATMs) at three new locations across Bahrain.
tag-1: Citibank Launches Three New ATMs at Three Locations Across Bahrain
tag-2: Manama, Bahrain – As part of its growth and expansion strategy, Citibank N.A. announced the installation of three automated teller machines (ATMs) at three new locations across Bahrain.
tag-3: Citibank introduced the new ATMs with enhanced technology and security. The ATMs were installed at Ramli Mall, Bahrain Financial Harbor and Isa Town (Jidali).
tag-4: The new ATMs will allow clients to bank anywhere and anytime, without the need to visit the branches. With its added new technologies, services and security features, the ATMs will enable the customers to have a better and more secure banking experience. Citibank offers an array of benefits to its clients through ATMs that include enabling cash withdrawals, deposits into accounts, credit card bill payments and other banking services on a 24-hour basis.
tag-5: Mr. Navneet Kampani, Head of Consumer Banking, said: "We are constantly investing in expanding our reach and bringing out more platforms to strengthen our communication with our customers. This expansion reflects our strategy of keeping our clients close to us and complies with our aims to enhance our presence in the local market."
tag-6: With these new ATMs, Citibank increases its ATM network to 18 locations across the Kingdom of Bahrain. Additionally, there are currently three branches in operation that provide direct services to citizens and residents six days per week.
tag-7: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
